captions.text:
Hey Vsauce! I'm Jake and I have an incredibly
important question ... Can You Deep Fry This?

I guess not but we should wait because patience
is a virtue.com. Naw, let's get this cursor

dance party started, with some more DONGs!
Things you can Do Online Now, Guys.

Travel back through time with My 80s TV. The
Channels are divided by year, so you can catch

some bodacious music videos, news reports,
clips from Movies, Television series, and

cartoons so you can like totally get a righteous
amount of them sweet 80s, bro.

Also, all the clips are sourced from YouTube
... even though YouTube didn't exist in the

80s so we probably just created some sort
of horrible time paradox and the fabric of

space time is being torn apart as we speak
and everything we have ever known or loved

will be ripped molecule by molecule by a massive
black hole all because we had to travel back
in time to the 80s.

But since we're here lets check out the Museum
of Mario, an interactive history of the Mario

Bros. franchise from his humble beginnings
as Jumpman in Donkey Kong to the Wii U, but

don't forget the amazing Game Boy Camera emulator
by Christine Love. You can adjust the color

scheme to replicate the look of Tetris, Metroid,
or Zelda. And also change the image quality

from 1 bit, 2 bit, or, if you are feeling
crazy, 5 bit.

Before getting on camera maybe paint your
nails hmmm I don't know how I feel about this

Color so let's Name that Blue a game where
you identify the specific shade of blue used

for different social networks or sports teams.
For more color there are these awesome RGB
Landscapes by Emilio Gomariz.

Then explore a landscape of words with fridge
word magnets, use the pieces to create phrases

and whatever changes you make are seen by
everyone who visits. But if you'd rather tell

a story use InkleWriter, an online tool that
allows you to create a Choose Your Own Adventure

style book, Does your character get captured
or does he Escape...Goat. In escape goat you

play as said goat who's been imprisoned for
witchcraft in this really fun platformer game.

You jump and ram through the levels in order
to free yourself. Then the clean up is left

to the Dungeon Janitor, a puzzle game where
you gotta mop up slime, really slippery slime.

Come here slime! What? How did you get over
there?! GAH! What a Mess. An online portal

for emulating old computers and consoles and
their games such as the TI-99, the Commodore

64, Atari 2600 and Game Boy. The MESS project
is incredibly impressive as they try and emulate

every computer that has ever existed. You
can even play the infamous ET game. And then
regret your life.

If all those old computers are making you
nostalgic you can listen to the sound of dial

up and relive the agonizing joys and noise
of connecting with a modem. Aww like horrible

music to my ears. While connecting use your
drawing skills with this Mac Paint simulator,

then keep the 1995 party rolling with this
Maze game based off the old Windows 95 Screen

saver. Avoid mice, pick up the N64 logo to
change your orientation, and change the wallpaper

to make things extra weird...but not as weird
as...

Okay let's just toss these cards in a hat.
While the concept is simple enough, you eventually

have start accounting for wind and different
distances by adjusting the angle and power

of the cards. Now that you've mastered cards
in hats, try drawings in a bottle. A fun site

where you leave a drawing for a random stranger
to view. However, if you want to see strangers

check out Geocam: a global map of live webcams
across the world. For example we can zoom

into the Canary Islands and see what's happening
on . Fascinating. Now let's look inward with

Your Brain Map. An interactive map of the
brain that shows where different functions

are located, for instance did you know the
Broca's area is responsible for language comprehension?

Well now you Knoword, a vocabulary game where
you must guess the word based on the first

letter and the definition. The game gets progressively
more difficult as you race against the clock

and..gah...I forgot what I was going to say
... I feel like there is WordsForThat (on

cam and wink), A website that utilizes a voting
system to find the perfect term for such phenomena

as "Stepping down heavily on a stair that
isn't there", which of course is an "airstair".

For some longer words try out the Distribution
of Word Lengths in Various Languages to see

which languages have the most and least characters
per word.

Then spend an incredible length of time with
the online lathe. You can carve metal or wood

and it is fantastic. Once you've finished
you can sell it at Ikea or Death, With Ikea

or Death you are given two different words
and have to determine which one is a lovely

and modern Ikea product and which is a BRUTAL
DEATH METAL BAND! Such as Bastig, Absu, Vittsjo.

So many consonants. WHERE ARE THE VOWELS SWEDEN!?
SWEDEN!!

Make your own music with this really cool
generator called Radar. Then use Mumu, an

online service that allows you to create a
playlist and share the unique url with your
friends, so they can listen along with you.

For more music, there is the first ever YouTube
Music Awards happening on November 3rd and
you can vote for your favorites right now.

But if that is not enough music for you, I
made a new JAM, a Just Awesome Music leanback

for you over on WEsauce and there is even
a new Riddle Challenge from Kevin there too.

So check those out, play with your DONGs and,
as always, thanks for watching.

title: Online GAME BOY CAMERA and more!! -- DONG
